{"step_by_step_thinking": "The mandible, or lower jaw, is a bone that is subjected to various forces during activities such as chewing, speaking, and swallowing. When a fracture occurs, the forces acting on the mandible change. The alveolar border of the mandible, where the teeth are located, is subjected to compression forces. This is because the force of biting down or clenching the teeth compresses this area.", "answer_choice": "B. Compression"}
